intro: Aulospermum planosum, commonly known as the flatleaf aulospermum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, oblanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Aulospermum planosum is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its succulent leaves and deep root system. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
